result.execSummary:
The defendant Frank A Seitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Court orders bond on file to be applied. Costs are paid in full.

Defendant to undergo a Psychological Evaluation and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent. This may be satisfied by the current counseling the defendant is undertaking; however, that is at the discretion of the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is to have NO CONTACT with G. Brahmer.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

timeConds.notes: With Huber. No Good Time Credit

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Frank A Seitz

defendant.name: Seitz, Frank A
defendant.address: W4840 Portage St, Wild Rose, WI 54984

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 10:46 am case called. Defendant Frank A Seitz in court with attorney Jeremy J Guza.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement stated on record. Attorney Guza and defendant concur.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Guza. Statement by Defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: Imposed 5 months WCJ, STAYED and places the defendant on probation for a period of 1 year.  CONDITIONS: 5 days WCJ, with Huber-No Good Time Credit. Credit for 2 days time served. To be completed by July 1, 2016. Psychological evaluation-may be satisfied through current counseling.    The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No Contact with G. Brahmer. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Court orders bond on file to be applied.   DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 31, 2016 at 10:30 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Jeremy J Guza in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Guza requests plea/sentencing date  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on April 19, 2016 at 10:10 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Jeremy J Guza in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Guza requests additional time to watch video as part of discovery. DA Blader makes statement regarding video.  Status conference scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 10:10 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Jeremy J Guza in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Guza states he has received an offer. Counter offer going to the State-requests 30 day status.  Status conference scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 09:05 am.
from Atty Guza requesting adjournment - Granted by the Court

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Defendant is prohibited from being in possession of any dangerous weapons. Defendant is prohibited from being on the premises of the Ding Tavern.
Defendant appears via video from the WC Jail.

Case called @ 1:28 p.m. Defendant Frank A Seitz in court, in custody, appears via video.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant does not qualify for SPD services. Defendant will be privately retaining counsel.  NGP entered. DA Blader requesting $500 Cash Bond. No statement by the defendant regarding bond. Court orders $500 Cash Bond.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 02:20 pm.
